subject: Programming
title: The Power of Good Names
description: A quick win: understand The Power of Good Names.

hook.text: A variable called 'x' tells you nothing. A variable called 'userAge' tells you everything.

buildup.text: Good names reveal intent. You should never need a comment to explain what a variable holds.

discovery.text: Rename 'd' to 'elapsedDays' and suddenly the entire function makes sense without reading further.

twist.text: Naming is one of the two hardest problems in CS. Good names require deep understanding of the domain.

climax.text: A name that takes ten seconds longer to type saves ten minutes of confusion for every future reader.

punchline.text: Name things so strangers understand instantly.

quiz.question: Why are good variable names important?
